bullets.text: Trump says tariffs on South Korea to rise to 25%, pressuring Korean auto/pharma shares and risking escalation in global trade tensions and supply chains.
Commerce Department takes an equity stake in USA Rare Earth, signaling deeper U.S. industrial policy to secure critical minerals and reduce China dependence.
Iran assessed as politically weaker as U.S. warships move closer; Tehran threatens retaliation, raising regional conflict risk and potential energy-market volatility.
Fed likely to hold rates steady despite White House pressure, keeping borrowing costs elevated and reinforcing expectations for gradual, data-driven policy shifts.
Health insurers fall after proposal to keep Medicare Advantage rates flat next year, implying margin pressure and renewed political scrutiny of privatized Medicare.
Nvidia invests $2B in CoreWeave; markets interpret it as strategic capacity control for AI compute, while competition from custom silicon and TPUs intensifies.
Microsoft unveils second-gen Maia AI chip and wins approval for 15 Wisconsin data centers, underscoring hyperscaler push to vertically integrate AI infrastructure.
TikTok uninstalls jump after U.S. joint-venture deal; alternatives surge, highlighting platform-fragmentation risk and the sensitivity of consumer apps to geopolitics.
Severe winter storm linked to at least 22 deaths; combined with high utility bills, it spotlights grid resilience, affordability, and climate-linked extreme-weather risks.
FAA launches modernization and safety overhaul amid ongoing concerns at Reagan National; aviation safety upgrades can drive near-term compliance costs and operational changes.
New quantum work shows entangled atoms functioning as a single sensor, enabling much higher precision measurement—potentially transformative for navigation, timing, and defense sensing.
Cancer-evolution research identifies hidden rules shaping tumor development, supporting more predictive treatment strategies and accelerating precision-oncology drug design.
